intro: Egletes florida, commonly known as the Florida egletes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a clustered head. Egletes florida is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding and plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
